level-up.name: tackle
level-up.description:
A physical attack in which the user charges and
slams into the target with its whole body.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: poison-sting
level-up.description:
The user stabs the target with a poisonous stinger.
This may also poison the target.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

level-up.name: spikes
level-up.description:
The user lays a trap of spikes at the opposing
team’s feet. The trap hurts Pokémon that switch
into battle.
level-up.effect:
Scatters spikes around the opposing field, which damage opposing Pokémon that enter the field for 1/8 of their max HP.  Pokémon immune to ground moves are immune to this damage, except during gravity.  Up to three layers of spikes may be laid down, adding 1/16 to the damage done: two layers of spikes damage for 3/16 max HP, and three layers damage for 1/4 max HP.

wonder guard does not block damage from this effect.

rapid spin removes this effect from its user's side of the field.  defog removes this effect from its target's side of the field.

level-up.name: harden
level-up.description:
The user stiffens all the muscles in its body to raise
its Defense stat.
level-up.effect: Raises the user's Defense by one stage.

level-up.name: minimize
level-up.description:
The user compresses its body to make itself look
smaller, which sharply raises its evasiveness.
level-up.effect:
Raises the user's evasion by two stages.

stomp and steamroller have double power against Pokémon that have used this move since entering the field.

level-up.name: water-gun
level-up.description: The target is blasted with a forceful shot of water.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: pin-missile
level-up.description:
Sharp spikes are shot at the target in rapid
succession. They hit two to five times in a row.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

level-up.name: take-down
level-up.description:
A reckless, full-body charge attack for slamming into
the target. This also damages the user a little.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

level-up.name: hydro-pump
level-up.description:
The target is blasted by a huge volume of water
launched under great pressure.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

egg.name: supersonic
egg.description:
The user generates odd sound waves from its body
that confuse the target.
egg.effect: Confuses the target.

egg.name: bubble-beam
egg.description:
A spray of bubbles is forcefully ejected at the
target. This may also lower the target’s Speed stat.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

egg.name: haze
egg.description:
The user creates a haze that eliminates every stat
change among all the Pokémon engaged in battle.
egg.effect:
Removes stat, accuracy, and evasion modifiers from every Pokémon on the field.

This does not count as a stat reduction for the purposes of clear body or white smoke.

egg.name: flail
egg.description:
The user flails about aimlessly to attack. The less HP
the user has, the greater the move’s power.
egg.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power varies inversely with the user's proportional remaining HP.

64 * current HP / max HP | Power
-----------------------: | ----:
 0– 1                    |  200
 2– 5                    |  150
 6–12                    |  100
13–21                    |   80
22–42                    |   40
43–64                    |   20

tutor.name: ice-beam
tutor.description:
The target is struck with an icy-cold beam of energy.
This may also leave the target frozen.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to freeze the target.

machine.name: surf
machine.description:
The user attacks everything around it by swamping
its surroundings with a giant wave.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.

If the target is in the first turn of dive, this move will hit with double power.

machine.name: whirlpool
machine.description:
The user traps the target in a violent swirling
whirlpool for four to five turns.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  For the next 2–5 turns, the target cannot leave the field and is damaged for 1/16 its max HP at the end of each turn.  The user continues to use other moves during this time.  If the user leaves the field, this effect ends.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

If the target is in the first turn of dive, this move will hit with double power.

machine.name: waterfall
machine.description:
The user charges at the target and may make
it flinch.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: headbutt
machine.description:
The user sticks out its head and attacks by charging
straight into the target. This may also make the
target flinch.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: curse
machine.description:
A move that works differently for the Ghost type
than for all other types.
machine.effect:
If the user is a ghost: user pays half its max HP to place a curse on the target, damaging it for 1/4 its max HP every turn.
Otherwise: Lowers the user's Speed by one stage, and raises its Attack and Defense by one stage each.

The curse effect is passed on by baton pass.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.

machine.name: rollout
machine.description:
The user continually rolls into the target over five
turns. It becomes more powerful each time it hits.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to use this move for five turns.  Power doubles every time this move is used in succession to a maximum of 16x, and resets to normal after the lock-in ends.  If this move misses or becomes unusable, the lock-in ends.

If the user has used defense curl since entering the field, this move has double power.

machine.name: toxic
machine.description:
A move that leaves the target badly poisoned.
Its poison damage worsens every turn.
machine.effect: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: hidden-power
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IVs.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IVs.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

machine.name: snore
machine.description:
This attack can be used only if the user is asleep.
The harsh noise may also make the target flinch.
machine.effect: Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: blizzard
machine.description:
A howling blizzard is summoned to strike opposing
Pokémon. This may also leave the opposing
Pokémon frozen.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to freeze the target.

During hail, this move has 100% accuracy.  It also has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection of protect and detect.

machine.name: icy-wind
machine.description:
The user attacks with a gust of chilled air. This also
lowers opposing Pokémon’s Speed stats.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 100% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

machine.name: protect
machine.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
machine.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: rain-dance
machine.description:
The user summons a heavy rain that falls for five
turns, powering up Water-type moves. It lowers
the power of Fire-type moves.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to rain for five turns, during which water moves inflict 50% extra damage, and fire moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding damp rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

thunder has 100% accuracy.  If the target has used detect or protect, thunder has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

solar beam has half power.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal only 1/4 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with swift swim have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become water.

Pokémon with dry skin heal 1/8 max HP, Pokémon with hydration are cured of major status effects, and Pokémon with rain dish heal 1/16 max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: endure
machine.description:
The user endures any attack with at least 1 HP.
Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.
machine.effect:
The user's HP cannot be lowered below 1 by any means for the remainder of this turn.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: frustration
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: return
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: double-team
machine.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
machine.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: swagger
machine.description:
The user enrages and confuses the target. However,
this also sharply raises the target’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: sleep-talk
machine.description:
While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the
moves it knows.
machine.effect:
Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

machine.name: sludge-bomb
machine.description:
Unsanitary sludge is hurled at the target. This may
also poison the target.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

machine.name: swift
machine.description:
Star-shaped rays are shot at opposing Pokémon.
This attack never misses.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

machine.name: defense-curl
machine.description:
The user curls up to conceal weak spots and raise
its Defense stat.
machine.effect:
Raises user's Defense by one stage.

After this move is used, the power of ice ball and rollout are doubled until the user leaves the field.

machine.name: rest
machine.description:
The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully
restores the user’s HP and heals any
status conditions.
machine.effect:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early bird.

This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: attract
machine.description:
If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target
becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.
machine.effect: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

egg.name: astonish
egg.description:
The user attacks the target while shouting in a
startling fashion. This may also make the
target flinch.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

tutor.name: swords-dance
tutor.description:
A frenetic dance to uplift the fighting spirit.
This sharply raises the user’s Attack stat.
tutor.effect: Raises the user's Attack by two stages.

tutor.name: double-edge
tutor.description:
A reckless, life-risking tackle in which the user rushes
the target. This also damages the user quite a lot.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/3 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

tutor.name: thunder-wave
tutor.description:
The user launches a weak jolt of electricity that
paralyzes the target.
tutor.effect: Paralyzes the target.

tutor.name: mimic
tutor.description:
The user copies the target’s last move. The move
can be used during battle until the Pokémon is
switched out.
tutor.effect:
This move is replaced by the target's last successfully used move, and its PP changes to 5.  If the target hasn't used a move since entering the field, if it tried to use a move this turn and failed, or if the user already knows the targeted move, this move will fail.  This effect vanishes when the user leaves the field.

If chatter, metronome, mimic, sketch, or struggle is selected, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist or metronome, nor forced by encore.

tutor.name: defense-curl
tutor.description:
The user curls up to conceal weak spots and raise
its Defense stat.
tutor.effect:
Raises user's Defense by one stage.

After this move is used, the power of ice ball and rollout are doubled until the user leaves the field.

tutor.name: swift
tutor.description:
Star-shaped rays are shot at opposing Pokémon.
This attack never misses.
tutor.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Ignores accuracy and evasion modifiers.

tutor.name: substitute
tutor.description:
The user creates a substitute for itself using some of
its HP. The substitute serves as the user’s decoy.
tutor.effect:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effects, confusion, and flinching.  The effects of smelling salts and wake up slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap berry.  magic coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream eater, embargo, flatter, gastro acid, grudge, heal block, leech seed, lock on, mean look, mimic, mind reader, nightmare, pain split, psycho shift, spider web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to freeze the target.

During hail, this move has 100% accuracy.  It also has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection of protect and detect.

machine.name: protect
machine.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
machine.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: rain-dance
machine.description:
The user summons a heavy rain that falls for five
turns, powering up Water-type moves. It lowers
the power of Fire-type moves.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to rain for five turns, during which water moves inflict 50% extra damage, and fire moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding damp rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

thunder has 100% accuracy.  If the target has used detect or protect, thunder has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

solar beam has half power.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal only 1/4 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with swift swim have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become water.

Pokémon with dry skin heal 1/8 max HP, Pokémon with hydration are cured of major status effects, and Pokémon with rain dish heal 1/16 max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: rest
machine.description:
The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully
restores the user’s HP and heals any
status conditions.
machine.effect:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early bird.

This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: attract
machine.description:
If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target
becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.
machine.effect: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

level-up.name: tackle
level-up.description:
A physical attack in which the user charges and
slams into the target with its whole body.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: poison-sting
level-up.description:
The user stabs the target with a poisonous stinger.
This may also poison the target.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

level-up.name: spikes
level-up.description:
The user lays a trap of spikes at the opposing
team’s feet. The trap hurts Pokémon that switch
into battle.
level-up.effect:
Scatters spikes around the opposing field, which damage opposing Pokémon that enter the field for 1/8 of their max HP.  Pokémon immune to ground moves are immune to this damage, except during gravity.  Up to three layers of spikes may be laid down, adding 1/16 to the damage done: two layers of spikes damage for 3/16 max HP, and three layers damage for 1/4 max HP.

wonder guard does not block damage from this effect.

rapid spin removes this effect from its user's side of the field.  defog removes this effect from its target's side of the field.

level-up.name: harden
level-up.description:
The user stiffens all the muscles in its body to raise
its Defense stat.
level-up.effect: Raises the user's Defense by one stage.

level-up.name: minimize
level-up.description:
The user compresses its body to make itself look
smaller, which sharply raises its evasiveness.
level-up.effect:
Raises the user's evasion by two stages.

stomp and steamroller have double power against Pokémon that have used this move since entering the field.

level-up.name: water-gun
level-up.description: The target is blasted with a forceful shot of water.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: rollout
level-up.description:
The user continually rolls into the target over five
turns. It becomes more powerful each time it hits.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to use this move for five turns.  Power doubles every time this move is used in succession to a maximum of 16x, and resets to normal after the lock-in ends.  If this move misses or becomes unusable, the lock-in ends.

If the user has used defense curl since entering the field, this move has double power.

level-up.name: toxic-spikes
level-up.description:
The user lays a trap of poison spikes at the feet of
the opposing team. The spikes will poison opposing
Pokémon that switch into battle.
level-up.effect:
Scatters poisoned spikes around the opposing field, which poison opposing Pokémon that enter the field.  A second layer of these spikes may be laid down, in which case Pokémon will be badly poisoned instead.  Pokémon immune to either ground moves or being poisoned are immune to this effect.  Pokémon otherwise immune to ground moves are affected during gravity.

If a poison Pokémon not immune to ground moves enters a field covered with poisoned spikes, the spikes are removed.

rapid spin will remove this effect from its user's side of the field.  defog will remove this effect from its target's side of the field.

This move does not trigger synchronize, unless the Pokémon with synchronize was forced to enter the field by another effect such as roar.

Pokémon entering the field due to baton pass are not affected by this effect.

level-up.name: stockpile
level-up.description:
The user charges up power and raises both its
Defense and Sp. Def stats. The move can be used
three times.
level-up.effect:
Raises the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage each.  Stores energy for use with spit up and swallow.  Up to three levels of energy can be stored, and all are lost if the user leaves the field.  Energy is still stored even if the stat boosts cannot be applied.

If the user uses baton pass, the stat boosts are passed as normal, but the stored energy is not.

level-up.name: spit-up
level-up.description:
The power stored using the move Stockpile is
released at once in an attack. The more power
is stored, the greater the move’s power.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power is equal to 100 times the amount of energy stored by stockpile.  Ignores the random factor in the damage formula.  Stored energy is consumed, and the user's Defense and Special Defense are reset to what they would be if stockpile had not been used.  If the user has no energy stored, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.

level-up.name: revenge
level-up.description:
This attack move’s power is doubled if the user has
been hurt by the opponent in the same turn.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target damaged the user this turn and was the last to do so, this move has double power.

pain split does not count as damaging the user.

level-up.name: brine
level-up.description:
If the target’s HP is half or less, this attack will hit
with double the power.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target has less than half its max HP remaining, this move has double power.

level-up.name: pin-missile
level-up.description:
Sharp spikes are shot at the target in rapid
succession. They hit two to five times in a row.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

level-up.name: take-down
level-up.description:
A reckless, full-body charge attack for slamming into
the target. This also damages the user a little.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

level-up.name: aqua-tail
level-up.description:
The user attacks by swinging its tail as if it were a
vicious wave in a raging storm.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: poison-jab
level-up.description:
The target is stabbed with a tentacle, arm, or the like
steeped in poison. This may also poison the target.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

level-up.name: destiny-bond
level-up.description:
After using this move, if the user faints, the
Pokémon that landed the knockout hit also faints.
Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.
level-up.effect:
If the user faints before its next move, the Pokémon that fainted it will automatically faint.  End-of-turn damage is ignored.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

level-up.name: hydro-pump
level-up.description:

launched under great pressure.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

that confuse the target.
egg.effect: Confuses the target.

egg.description:

target. This may also lower the target’s Speed stat.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

egg.name: haze
egg.description:
The user creates a haze that eliminates every stat
change among all the Pokémon engaged in battle.
egg.effect:
Removes stat, accuracy, and evasion modifiers from every Pokémon on the field.

This does not count as a stat reduction for the purposes of clear body or white smoke.

egg.name: flail
egg.description:
The user flails about aimlessly to attack. The less HP
the user has, the greater the move’s power.
egg.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power varies inversely with the user's proportional remaining HP.

64 * current HP / max HP | Power
-----------------------: | ----:

13–21                    |   80
22–42                    |   40
43–64                    |   20

tutor.name: dive

The user bounces up high, then drops on the target
on the second turn. This may also leave the target
with paralysis.
tutor.effect:

The damage from hail and sandstorm still applies during the immune turn.

machine.name: hail
machine.description:
The user summons a hailstorm lasting five turns.
It damages all Pokémon except Ice types.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to hail for five turns, during which non-ice Pokémon are damaged for 1/16 their max HP at the end of every turn.

If the user is holding icy rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

blizzard has 100% accuracy.  If the target has used detect or protect, blizzard has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal only 1/4 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with snow cloak are exempt from this effect's damage.

machine.name: hidden-power
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IVs.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IVs.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

machine.name: taunt
machine.description:
The target is taunted into a rage that allows it to use
only attack moves for three turns.
machine.effect:
Target is forced to only use damaging moves for the next 3–5 turns, selected at random.  Moves that select other moves not known in advance do not count as damaging.

assist, copycat, me first, metronome, mirror move, and sleep talk do not directly inflict damage and thus may not be used.

bide, counter, endeavor, metal burst, and mirror coat are allowed.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

this also sharply raises the target’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: substitute
machine.description:
The user creates a substitute for itself using some of
its HP. The substitute serves as the user’s decoy.
machine.effect:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effects, confusion, and flinching.  The effects of smelling salts and wake up slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap berry.  magic coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream eater, embargo, flatter, gastro acid, grudge, heal block, leech seed, lock on, mean look, mimic, mind reader, nightmare, pain split, psycho shift, spider web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

Up to three layers of spikes may be laid down, adding 1/16 to the damage done: two layers of spikes damage for 3/16 max HP, and three layers damage for 1/4 max HP.

wonder guard does not block damage from this effect.

rapid spin removes this effect from its user's side of the field.  defog removes this effect from its target's side of the field.

A second layer of these spikes may be laid down, in which case Pokémon will be badly poisoned instead.  Pokémon immune to either ground moves or being poisoned are immune to this effect.  Pokémon otherwise immune to ground moves are affected during gravity.

If a poison Pokémon not immune to ground moves enters a field covered with poisoned spikes, the spikes are removed.

rapid spin will remove this effect from its user's side of the field.  defog will remove this effect from its target's side of the field.

blizzard has 100% accuracy.  If the target has used detect or protect, blizzard has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal only 1/4 of the user's max HP.

machine.name: hidden-power
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IVs.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IVs.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

assist, copycat, me first, metronome, mirror move, and sleep talk do not directly inflict damage and thus may not be used.

bide, counter, endeavor, metal burst, and mirror coat are allowed.

* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn

A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.

level-up.name: tackle
level-up.description:
A physical attack in which the user charges and
slams into the target with its whole body.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: poison-sting
level-up.description:
The user stabs the target with a poisonous stinger.
This may also poison the target.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

level-up.name: water-gun
level-up.description: The target is blasted with a forceful shot of water.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: hydro-pump
level-up.description:
The target is blasted by a huge volume of water
launched under great pressure.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: spikes
level-up.description:
The user lays a trap of spikes at the opposing
team’s feet. The trap hurts Pokémon that switch
into battle.
level-up.effect:
Scatters spikes around the opposing field, which damage opposing Pokémon that enter the field for 1/8 of their max HP.  Pokémon immune to ground moves are immune to this damage, except during gravity.  Up to three layers of spikes may be laid down, adding 1/16 to the damage done: two layers of spikes damage for 3/16 max HP, and three layers damage for 1/4 max HP.

wonder guard does not block damage from this effect.

rapid spin removes this effect from its user's side of the field.  defog removes this effect from its target's side of the field.

level-up.name: destiny-bond
level-up.description:
After using this move, if the user faints, the
Pokémon that landed the knockout hit also faints.
Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.
level-up.effect:
If the user faints before its next move, the Pokémon that fainted it will automatically faint.  End-of-turn damage is ignored.

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

level-up.name: fell-stinger
level-up.description:
When the user knocks out a target with this move,
the user’s Attack stat rises drastically.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Raises the user's Attack by two stages if it KOs the target.

level-up.name: harden
level-up.description:
The user stiffens all the muscles in its body to raise
its Defense stat.
level-up.effect: Raises the user's Defense by one stage.

level-up.name: minimize
level-up.description:
The user compresses its body to make itself look
smaller, which sharply raises its evasiveness.
level-up.effect:
Raises the user's evasion by two stages.

stomp and steamroller have double power against Pokémon that have used this move since entering the field.

level-up.name: bubble
level-up.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

level-up.name: rollout
level-up.description:
The user continually rolls into the target over five
turns. It becomes more powerful each time it hits.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  User is forced to use this move for five turns.  Power doubles every time this move is used in succession to a maximum of 16x, and resets to normal after the lock-in ends.  If this move misses or becomes unusable, the lock-in ends.

If the user has used defense curl since entering the field, this move has double power.

level-up.name: toxic-spikes
level-up.description:
The user lays a trap of poison spikes at the feet of
the opposing team. The spikes will poison opposing
Pokémon that switch into battle.
level-up.effect:
Scatters poisoned spikes around the opposing field, which poison opposing Pokémon that enter the field.  A second layer of these spikes may be laid down, in which case Pokémon will be badly poisoned instead.  Pokémon immune to either ground moves or being poisoned are immune to this effect.  Pokémon otherwise immune to ground moves are affected during gravity.

If a poison Pokémon not immune to ground moves enters a field covered with poisoned spikes, the spikes are removed.

rapid spin will remove this effect from its user's side of the field.  defog will remove this effect from its target's side of the field.

This move does not trigger synchronize, unless the Pokémon with synchronize was forced to enter the field by another effect such as roar.

Pokémon entering the field due to baton pass are not affected by this effect.

level-up.name: stockpile
level-up.description:
The user charges up power and raises both its
Defense and Sp. Def stats. The move can be used
three times.
level-up.effect:
Raises the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage each.  Stores energy for use with spit up and swallow.  Up to three levels of energy can be stored, and all are lost if the user leaves the field.  Energy is still stored even if the stat boosts cannot be applied.

If the user uses baton pass, the stat boosts are passed as normal, but the stored energy is not.

level-up.name: spit-up
level-up.description:
The power stored using the move Stockpile is
released at once in an attack. The more power
is stored, the greater the move’s power.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power is equal to 100 times the amount of energy stored by stockpile.  Ignores the random factor in the damage formula.  Stored energy is consumed, and the user's Defense and Special Defense are reset to what they would be if stockpile had not been used.  If the user has no energy stored, this move will fail.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move.

level-up.name: revenge
level-up.description:
This attack move’s power is doubled if the user has
been hurt by the opponent in the same turn.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  If the target damaged the user this turn and was the last to do so, this move has double power.

pain split does not count as damaging the user.

level-up.name: brine
level-up.description:
If the target’s HP is half or less, this attack will hit
with double the power.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target has less than half its max HP remaining, this move has double power.

level-up.name: pin-missile
level-up.description:
Sharp spikes are shot at the target in rapid
succession. They hit two to five times in a row.
level-up.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Hits 2–5 times in one turn.

Has a 3/8 chance each to hit 2 or 3 times, and a 1/8 chance each to hit 4 or 5 times.  Averages to 3 hits per use.

level-up.name: take-down
level-up.description:
A reckless, full-body charge attack for slamming into
the target. This also damages the user a little.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  User takes 1/4 the damage it inflicts in recoil.

level-up.name: aqua-tail
level-up.description:
The user attacks by swinging its tail as if it were a
vicious wave in a raging storm.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: poison-jab
level-up.description:
The target is stabbed with a tentacle, arm, or the like
steeped in poison. This may also poison the target.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

After using this move, if the user faints, the

level-up.effect:

level-up.description:
The target is blasted by a huge volume of water

level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

level-up.name: fell-stinger
level-up.description:
When the user knocks out a target with this move,
the user’s Attack stat rises drastically.
level-up.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Raises the user's Attack by two stages if it KOs the target.

egg.name: supersonic
egg.description:
The user generates odd sound waves from its body
that confuse the target.
egg.effect: Confuses the target.

egg.name: bubble-beam
egg.description:
A spray of bubbles is forcefully ejected at the
target. This may also lower the target’s Speed stat.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to lower the target's Speed by one stage.

egg.name: haze
egg.description:
The user creates a haze that eliminates every stat
change among all the Pokémon engaged in battle.
egg.effect:
Removes stat, accuracy, and evasion modifiers from every Pokémon on the field.

This does not count as a stat reduction for the purposes of clear body or white smoke.

egg.name: flail
egg.description:
The user flails about aimlessly to attack. The less HP
the user has, the greater the move’s power.
egg.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power varies inversely with the user's proportional remaining HP.

64 * current HP / max HP | Power
-----------------------: | ----:
 0– 1                    |  200
 2– 5                    |  150
 6–12                    |  100
13–21                    |   80
22–42                    |   40
43–64                    |   20

egg.name: astonish
egg.description:
The user attacks the target while shouting in a
startling fashion. This may also make the
target flinch.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to make the target flinch.

egg.name: signal-beam
egg.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to confuse the target.

egg.name: water-pulse
egg.description:
The user attacks the target with a pulsing blast of
water. This may also confuse the target.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to confuse the target.

egg.name: brine
egg.description:
If the target’s HP is half or less, this attack will hit
with double the power.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target has less than half its max HP remaining, this move has double power.

egg.description:
The user lunges at the target at a speed that makes
it almost invisible. This move always goes first.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.

egg.name: acid-spray

The user spits fluid that works to melt the target.
This harshly lowers the target’s Sp. Def stat.
egg.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Lowers the target's Special Defense by two stages.

machine.name: surf
machine.description:
The user attacks everything around it by swamping
its surroundings with a giant wave.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.

If the target is in the first turn of dive, this move will hit with double power.

machine.name: waterfall
machine.description:
The user charges at the target and may make
it flinch.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to make the target flinch.

machine.name: toxic
machine.description:
A move that leaves the target badly poisoned.
Its poison damage worsens every turn.
machine.effect: Badly poisons the target.  Never misses when used by a poison-type Pokémon.

machine.name: hail
machine.description:
The user summons a hailstorm lasting five turns.
It damages all Pokémon except Ice types.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to hail for five turns, during which non-ice Pokémon are damaged for 1/16 their max HP at the end of every turn.

If the user is holding icy rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

blizzard has 100% accuracy.  If the target has used detect or protect, blizzard has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal only 1/4 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with snow cloak are exempt from this effect's damage.

machine.name: venoshock
machine.description:
The user drenches the target in a special poisonous
liquid. This move’s power is doubled if the target
is poisoned.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target is poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: hidden-power
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Power and type are determined by the user's IVs.

Power is given by `x * 40 / 63 + 30`.  `x` is obtained by arranging bit 1 from the IV for each of Special Defense, Special Attack, Speed, Defense, Attack, and HP in that order.  (Bit 1 is 1 if the IV is of the form `4n + 2` or `4n + 3`.  `x` is then 64 * Special Defense IV bit 1, plus 32 * Special Attack IV bit 1, etc.)

Power is always between 30 and 70, inclusive.  Average power is 49.5.

Type is given by `y * 15 / 63`, where `y` is similar to `x` above, except constructed from bit 0.  (Bit 0 is 1 if the IV is odd.)  The result is looked up in the following table.

Value | Type
----: | --------
    0 | fighting
    1 | flying
    2 | poison
    3 | ground
    4 | rock
    5 | bug
    6 | ghost
    7 | steel
    8 | fire
    9 | water
   10 | grass
   11 | electric
   12 | psychic
   13 | ice
   14 | dragon
   15 | dark

This move thus cannot be normal.  Most other types have an equal 1/16 chance to be selected, given random IVs.  However, due to the flooring used here, bug, fighting, and grass appear 5/64 of the time, and dark only 1/64 of the time.

machine.name: confide
machine.description:
The user tells the target a secret, and the target
loses its ability to concentrate. This lowers
the target’s Sp. Atk stat.
machine.effect: Lowers the target's Special Attack by one stage.

machine.name: taunt
machine.description:
The target is taunted into a rage that allows it to use
only attack moves for three turns.
machine.effect:
Target is forced to only use damaging moves for the next 3–5 turns, selected at random.  Moves that select other moves not known in advance do not count as damaging.

assist, copycat, me first, metronome, mirror move, and sleep talk do not directly inflict damage and thus may not be used.

bide, counter, endeavor, metal burst, and mirror coat are allowed.

machine.name: ice-beam
machine.description:
The target is struck with an icy-cold beam of energy.
This may also leave the target frozen.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to freeze the target.

machine.name: blizzard
machine.description:
A howling blizzard is summoned to strike opposing
Pokémon. This may also leave the opposing
Pokémon frozen.
machine.effect:
Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to freeze the target.

During hail, this move has 100% accuracy.  It also has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection of protect and detect.

machine.name: protect
machine.description:
This move enables the user to protect itself from
all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used
in succession.
machine.effect:
No moves will hit the user for the remainder of this turn.  If the user is last to act this turn, this move will fail.

If the user successfully used detect, endure, protect, quick guard, or wide guard on the last turn, this move has a 50% chance to fail.

lock on, mind reader, and no guard provide a (100 – accuracy)% chance for moves to break through this move.  This does not apply to one-hit KO moves (fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold); those are always blocked by this move.

thunder during rain dance and blizzard during hail have a 30% chance to break through this move.

The following effects are not prevented by this move:

* acupressure from an ally
* curse's curse effect
* Delayed damage from doom desire and future sight; however, these moves will be prevented if they are used this turn
* feint, which will also end this move's protection after it hits
* imprison
* perish song
* shadow force
* Moves that merely copy the user, such as transform or psych up

This move cannot be selected by assist or metronome.

machine.name: rain-dance
machine.description:
The user summons a heavy rain that falls for five
turns, powering up Water-type moves. It lowers
the power of Fire-type moves.
machine.effect:
Changes the weather to rain for five turns, during which water moves inflict 50% extra damage, and fire moves inflict half damage.

If the user is holding damp rock, this effect lasts for eight turns.

thunder has 100% accuracy.  If the target has used detect or protect, thunder has a (100 - accuracy)% chance to break through the protection.

solar beam has half power.

moonlight, morning sun, and synthesis heal only 1/4 of the user's max HP.

Pokémon with swift swim have doubled original Speed.

Pokémon with forecast become water.

Pokémon with dry skin heal 1/8 max HP, Pokémon with hydration are cured of major status effects, and Pokémon with rain dish heal 1/16 max HP at the end of each turn.

machine.name: frustration
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases inversely with happiness, given by `(255 - happiness) * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: return
machine.description:
This move can’t be used.
It’s recommended that this move is forgotten.
Once forgotten, this move can’t be remembered.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with happiness, given by `happiness * 2 / 5`, to a maximum of 102.  Power bottoms out at 1.

machine.name: shadow-ball
machine.description:
The user hurls a shadowy blob at the target.
This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 20% chance to lower the target's Special Defense by one stage.

machine.name: double-team
machine.description:
By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of
itself to raise its evasiveness.
machine.effect: Raises the user's evasion by one stage.

machine.name: sludge-wave
machine.description:
The user strikes everything around it by swamping
the area with a giant sludge wave. This may also
poison those hit.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 10% chance to poison the target.

machine.name: sludge-bomb
machine.description:
Unsanitary sludge is hurled at the target. This may
also poison the target.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

machine.name: facade
machine.description:
This attack move doubles its power if the user is
poisoned, burned, or paralyzed.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the user is burned, paralyzed, or poisoned, this move has double power.

machine.name: rest
machine.description:
The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully
restores the user’s HP and heals any
status conditions.
machine.effect:
User falls to sleep and immediately regains all its HP.  If the user has another major status effect, sleep will replace it.  The user will always wake up after two turns, or one turn with early bird.

This move fails if the Pokémon cannot fall asleep due to uproar, insomnia, or vital spirit.  It also fails if the Pokémon is at full health or is already asleep.

machine.name: attract
machine.description:
If it is the opposite gender of the user, the target
becomes infatuated and less likely to attack.
machine.effect: Causes the target to fall in love with the user, giving it a 50% chance to do nothing each turn.  If the user and target are the same gender, or either is genderless, this move will fail.  If either Pokémon leaves the field, this effect ends.

machine.name: round
machine.description:
The user attacks the target with a song. Others can
join in the Round to increase the power of
the attack.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If round has already been used this turn, this move's power is doubled.  After this move is used, any other Pokémon using it this turn will immediately do so (in the order they would otherwise act), regardless of Speed or priority.  Pokémon using other moves will then continue to act as usual.

machine.name: scald
machine.description:
The user shoots boiling hot water at its target.
This may also leave the target with a burn.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to burn the target.

machine.name: explosion
machine.description:
The user attacks everything around it by causing a
tremendous explosion. The user faints upon using
this move.
machine.effect: User faints, even if the attack fails or misses.  Inflicts regular damage.

machine.name: payback
machine.description:
The user stores power, then attacks. If the user
moves after the target, this attack’s power will
be doubled.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  If the target uses a move or switches out this turn before this move is used, this move has double power.

machine.name: thunder-wave
machine.description:
The user launches a weak jolt of electricity that
paralyzes the target.
machine.effect: Paralyzes the target.

machine.name: gyro-ball
machine.description:
The user tackles the target with a high-speed spin.
The slower the user compared to the target, the
greater the move’s power.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Power increases with the target's current Speed compared to the user, given by `1 + 25 * target Speed / user Speed`, capped at 150.

machine.name: poison-jab
machine.description:
The target is stabbed with a tentacle, arm, or the like
steeped in poison. This may also poison the target.
machine.effect: Inflicts regular damage.  Has a 30% chance to poison the target.

machine.name: swagger
machine.description:
The user enrages and confuses the target. However,
this also sharply raises the target’s Attack stat.
machine.effect: Raises the target's Attack by two stages, then confuses it.  If the target's Attack cannot be raised by two stages, the confusion is not applied.

machine.name: sleep-talk
machine.description:
While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the
moves it knows.
machine.effect:
Only usable if the user is sleeping.  Randomly selects and uses one of the user's other three moves.  Use of the selected move requires and costs 0 PP.

This move will not select assist, bide, bounce, chatter, copycat, dig, dive, fly, focus punch, me first, metronome, mirror move, shadow force, skull bash, sky attack, sky drop, sleep talk, solar beam, razor wind, or uproar.

If the selected move requires a recharge turn—i.e., one of blast burn, frenzy plant, giga impact, hydro cannon, hyper beam, roar of time, or rock wrecker—and the user is still sleeping next turn, then it's forced to use this move again and pay another PP for the recharge turn.

This move cannot be copied by mirror move, nor selected by assist, metronome, or sleep talk.

machine.name: substitute
machine.description:
The user creates a substitute for itself using some of
its HP. The substitute serves as the user’s decoy.
machine.effect:
Transfers 1/4 the user's max HP into a doll that absorbs damage and causes most negative move effects to fail.  If the user leaves the field, the doll will vanish.  If the user cannot pay the HP cost, this move will fail.

The doll takes damage as normal, using the user's stats and types, and will break when its HP reaches zero.  Self-inflicted damage from confusion or recoil is not absorbed.  Healing effects from opponents ignore the doll and heal the user as normal.  Moves that work based on the user's HP still do so; the doll's HP does not influence any move.

The doll will block major status effects, confusion, and flinching.  The effects of smelling salts and wake up slap do not trigger against a doll, even if the Pokémon behind the doll has the appropriate major status effect.  Multi-turn trapping moves like wrap will hit the doll for their regular damage, but the multi-turn trapping and damage effects will not activate.

Moves blocked or damage absorbed by the doll do not count as hitting the user or inflicting damage for any effects that respond to such, e.g., avalanche, counter, or a rowap berry.  magic coat still works as normal, even against moves the doll would block.  Opposing Pokémon that damage the doll with a leech move like absorb are healed as normal.

It will also block acupressure, block, the curse effect of curse, dream eater, embargo, flatter, gastro acid, grudge, heal block, leech seed, lock on, mean look, mimic, mind reader, nightmare, pain split, psycho shift, spider web, sketch, swagger, switcheroo, trick, worry seed, and yawn.  A Pokémon affected by yawn before summoning the doll will still fall to sleep.

The doll blocks intimidate, but all other abilities act as though the doll did not exist.  If the user has an ability that absorbs moves of a certain type for HP (such as volt absorb absorbing thunder wave), such moves will not be blocked.

life orb and berries that cause confusion still work as normal, but their respective HP loss and confusion are absorbed/blocked by the doll.

The user is still vulnerable to damage inflicted when entering or leaving the field, such as by pursuit or spikes; however, the doll will block the poison effect of toxic spikes.

The doll is passed on by baton pass.  It keeps its existing HP, but uses the replacement Pokémon's stats and types for damage calculation.

All other effects work as normal.
